#include <stdio.h>
#include <stdlib.h>
typedef char bool;
#define true  1
#define false 1


int main(int argc, char** argv)
{
	int N, X, Y, i, j;
	
	scanf("%d%d%d", &N, &X, &Y);
	
	int* a = (int*)calloc(N + 10, sizeof(int));
	for (i = 0; i < N; i++)
	{
		scanf("%d", &a[i]);
		a[i]--;
	}
	
	int W = Y - X;
	if (W < 0) W = 0;
	int* d = (int*)calloc(W/32 + 10, sizeof(int));
	d[0] = 1;
	for (i = 0; i < N; i++)
		for (j = a[i]; j <= W; j++){
			if (((d [ (j - a[i])/32] >> ((j - a[i]) % 32))  & 1))
				d [ j/32] |= (1 << (j%32));
			}
	if (((d [ W/32] >> (W % 32))  & 1)) printf("POSSIBLE\n");
	else printf("IMPOSSIBLE\n");
	free(a); free(d);
	return 0;
}
